data.title: Diverse Abilities Programming + Support
data.meta_description: The Jack and Shirley Silver Center for Diverse Abilities builds an inclusive + accepting community where all individuals and their families can participate and succeed.
data.text:
CORE Summer Tuesdays: Music Class

CORE Summer Tuesdays: Music Class

In Person. Each week, our classically trained music instructor will lead the class on a musical journey of diverse genres and themes. Participants will learn how to use a variety of instruments and how to play them together.

Dates: Jun 25 + Jul 2, 9,16,23,30 + Aug 6, 13, 20

810.00

Members

810.00

Public

CORE Summer Tuesdays: Fitness Class

CORE Summer Tuesdays: Fitness Class

In Person. Build your CORE strength with Coach Angela! Coach Angela is a certified CrossFit Level 1 and Adaptive Special Needs Level 1 Trainer with over a decade of experience in the fitness industry. Participants will learn various forms of adaptive fitness to build strength and wellness.

775.00

Members

775.00

Public

Adaptations Literary Club

Adaptations Literary Club

In Person + Virtual. The next great piece of writing could be yours! In Literary Club, you will practice expressing yourself through journal writing, poetry, essays, humor pieces, television scripts, and more.

10.00

Members

10.00

Public

Adaptations Methods and Materials: Community Quilt

Adaptations Methods and Materials: Community Quilt

In Person. Each month, this Adaptations art class features a different artistic method or material! This month, we will each create a drawing to contribute to our Adaptations community quilt.

15.00

Members

15.00

Public

Adaptations Women's Group: Nail Salon Outing

Adaptations Women's Group: Nail Salon Outing

In Person. Are you a woman who is looking to learn alongside others who share similar experiences? Join us bimonthly for our Women's Group to learn self-awareness, self-advocacy, and interpersonal skills. This month, we are heading to a local nail salon for an evening of community and self care.

5.00

Members

5.00

Public

Adaptations Men's Group: Summer Wrap Up

Members

Adaptations Wheel of Fortune Game Night: Standard Ticket

In Person. Wednesday nights just got a whole lot more fun. Once a month, Adaptations will host a game night of epic proportions featuring your favorite games but bigger and better. Think hosts, buzzers, and so much more.

Adaptations Rooftop Paint, Sip, & Snack

Adaptations Rooftop Paint, Sip, & Snack

In Person. Join us for a relaxing Paint and Sip on the rooftop, where you'll capture the breathtaking skyline on canvas. Enjoy a selection of delightful snacks and beverages as you paint your masterpiece with guidance from our instructor Heidi.

Adaptations Lounge

CORE Fall Tuesdays: Music Class

CORE Fall Tuesdays: Music Class

In Person. Each week our classically trained music instructor will lead the class on a musical journey of diverse genres and themes. In doing so, class members will learn how to use a variety of instruments and how to play their instruments together.

CORE Fall Tuesdays: Art in Action

CORE Fall Tuesdays: Art in Action

In Person. Want to learn more about the world's most famous artists and artistic mediums? Each month, CORE is taking a deep dive into the life and technique of various artists from around the world. Classes will include: museum outings, art history lectures, art classes and more.

Adaptations @ The Ballgame: Brooklyn Vs. Wilmington

Adaptations @ The Ballgame: Brooklyn Vs. Wilmington

In Person. Are you a baseball fan? This Minor League baseball game will feature the Coney Island Cyclones and Wilmington Blue Rocks for a game to remember. Your ticket will come with your choice of a hamburger, hot dog, or chicken tenders.

Adaptations Fall Kick Off Party

Adaptations Fall Kick Off Party

In Person. Celebrate the new year with us at this Fall Kick-Off Party! Enjoy seasonal treats, fun activities, and good company as we embrace the start of fall together. It’s the perfect chance to connect with friends and welcome the season with cheer. Don’t miss out!

CORE Fall Sundays: NYC History Class

CORE Fall Sundays: NYC History Class

In Person. Join us for Our CORE NYC History Class this Fall. Participants will continue to learn about New York historical facts through educational experiences such as architectural tours, local theater performances and historical site visits throughout the city.

In Person. Chop! Bake! Pour! Chef Jenny Plewka will teach you kitchen skills and lunch recipes that you can replicate at home to wow your friends and family. This cooking class will be followed by a group meal. Please notify your instructor in advance of any accommodations or food allergies.

Support Group: Parents of Adults with Developmental Delays, LD, or ADHD Section 1

Support Group: Parents of Adults with Developmental Delays, LD, or ADHD Section 1

Parents of adults with developmental delays, LD, ASD, or ADHD face issues and concerns related to independent living, employment, housing, and questions such as "What happens when I'm gone?" This group will provide an opportunity for parents to come together to share resources and experiences, solve problems, a
